Does anyone still not know what Portal 2 is? It's one of those games that everyone knows is good... and actually is good, too. If you really haven't heard of it though, it's a first person shooter puzzle game where you shoot portals instead of bullets. It's a really unique mechanic that is applied (along with other neat mechanics) to a really well thought out game, with lots of mind bending puzzles and humorous banter surrounding an engaging plot. It's probably good to play the original Portal first, since this game definitely does reference it, but I don't think it's necessary.

Also, it has a level editor and a co-op campaign! Those are like, two of my favorite things in games...

Apparently I haven't written a review for this game, so I guess I will now.

For starters, this game is the reason I got a Steam account in the first place. My brother's friend came over with the 360 disc and I stayed up all night playing. Then, of course, he took the game when he left. I immediately wanted to continue playing, I was hooked from that point forward. Played through the entirety of it on some awful computer and getting 582 FPS average. It was worth every second of it, honestly. 

The campaign is, of course, one of the standout singleplayer modes of gaming. The difficulty curve is well-done, the humor is always well-executed and there's tons of places to listen to additional dialogue if you feel like waiting to see what happens.
Then, of course, the co-op is a solid continuation of said singleplayer but continues the curve with the addition of a second set of portals and, of course, another person to cooperate with. I have tons of good memories with friends and randoms alike, especially the moments where you have to decide if you REALLY want to solve right then and there or if you want to move the bridge your partner's relying on.
And, to top it all off, there's a leaderboard system that allows you to go for least time/portals with your friends. To this day I occasionally check on my scores to make sure nobody's beaten them, and it's always a pleasant surprise when someone has.

All in all, the game's simply amazing. If the fact that it's the #1 rated game on Steam with 121,015 Positive reviews to 1,586 Negative doesn't indicate its sheer quality, I don't know what will. It's a great game that came from a time when Valve still made them, and it will forever hold a special place in my heart.

"Hermoso, divertidísimo, carismático, gracioso, curioso y algo complicado", así describiría yo a ésta secuela que derrotó a su antecesor. 
Tengo que admitir que no soy muy fan del capítulo 7, pero todo lo demás, lo amé.
Por cierto, me encantó esa cinemática de despedida.

Por onde posso começar a falar como eu amo esse jogo?

Provavelmente pela história, que mesmo com poucos personagens e um enredo bem linear é simplesmente incrível, conseguindo tratar aspectos do presente e passado de forma concisa e cativante.

Também os puzzles, que te fazem quebrar a cabeça até você acreditar que conseguiu resolver e descobrir que tem que quebrar a cabeça de novo e mesmo assim sem causar muito sentimento de frustração. Isso sem precisar criar muitas novas mecânicas além das estabelicidas no início do jogo.

Mas acredito que principalmente o coop. Que coisa linda é o modo multiplayer desse jogo. Ele tem tudo que eu falei anteriormente, mas trabalha excepcionalmente a interação entre dois jogadores para resolução de seus puzzles. Depois que pude jogar o modo coop com um amigo, passei a acreditar que esse jogo foi feito com esse aspecto em primeiro lugar.
a great game to play with a friend. This game does not lose the grace pos when you get bored and just make a prank with your friend that the tense atimosfera becomes one but pleasant

[h1] Portal 2 | 9/10[/h1]
This game takes place in a testing lab. And, it definitely feel like it.
You are able to completely levels and courses in really different ways while not breaking the game, it's originality is something that most games out there lack, and it's storyline and Co-Op just make it one of my favorite games in this platform.

It also has a really interesting speedrun community. If you like that sort of thing.

This game is extremely cheap on sale, so you should just pick it up regardless on what you think about it.

This series was so enjoyable.
First one felt pretty fast, but this one was perfect to all standards. I enjoyed the game so much!

Portal comes back with it's 2nd Game. The mechanics and puzzles are even better than before and everything just looks more polished and thought out. The subtle Story is also just as good as the Game before. One small complaint though is that you don't have the same atmosphere that you got from the first game which may be due to the knowing of the danger that is Portal. 7.9/10
i take back everything I said jesus christ the last game that made me feel this type of way was rdr2. 10/10 this game is too amazing.

One of the best games I've ever played. The story is great - and I generally like story-driven games more than ones with great gameplay but no story - and the characters were hilarious, I can't count how many times I facepalmed at Wheatley or almost died of laughter over something GLaDOS said. (Side note: I'm lowkey in love with her and very much liked her roasting. It's like she googled "how to insult humans" and just mixed all the result together without really knowing how they were supposed to hurt anyone's feelings.) The gameplay is awesome, it's incredible how many different puzzles can be done with so few simple elements, and they are challenging but not too hard. I can't come up with any reason why you shouldn't play this game. Just do it.
